info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 29 at 7:49PM EDT until March 30 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Gray ME
info.description:
...LONG DURATION LATE SEASON WINTER STORM CONTINUES...
.Another round of wintry mixed precipitation will gradually move north overnight. It may take the better part of the night for precipitation to reach parts of the Kennebec River Valley and Moosehead Lake region. Snow, sleet, and freezing rain are all expected at some point before precipitation comes to an end as rain showers.
* WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch, sleet accumulations between one tenth and two tenths of an inch, and ice accumulations around two tenths of an inch.
* WHERE...Strafford, Coastal Rockingham, Eastern Hillsborough, and Interior Rockingham Counties.
* WHEN...Until noon EDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible due to icy road conditions. This is especially true on untreated side roads. Limited power outage threat due to snapped and weighted branches. Travel will be dangerous and is not advised due to icy road conditions.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT SUNDAY

area.areaDesc: Strafford; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Coastal Rockingham
